164001.name: Halloween 2013: Cera
164001.description:
From publisher blurb:

Un grupo de jóvenes en busca de diversión, se internan a medianoche en un misterioso Museo de Cera. Allí las carcajadas darán paso a la noche más terrorífica de sus vidas.


Translation courtesy of Google:

A group of young people looking for fun, was admitted at midnight in a mysterious Wax Museum. There's laughter will lead to the most terrifying night of their lives.

164002.name: Especial Halloween 2012: Vuelo AA6005
164002.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unas horas antes del despegue, el vuelo de American Airlines AA 6005 con salida Nueva York (EEUU) y destino Patna (India), es cancelado ya que debe transportar el cuerpo sin vida de la joven esposa de un importante empresario indio. Sólo la tripulación mínima y algunos pasajeros con permiso especial son admitidos. El siniestro vuelo parece transcurrir con normalidad hasta que el cuerpo de la muchacha desaparece y con ella uno de los pasajeros.


Translation courtesy of Google:

A few hours before takeoff, American Airlines flight AA 6005 departing New York (USA) and destination Patna (India), is canceled because it must carry the lifeless body of the young wife of an important Indian businessman. Only the minimum crew and some passengers with special permission are allowed. The incident flight seems to pass normally through the body of the girl disappears and with it one of the passengers.

164003.name: Strange Writings
164003.description:
From publisher blurb:

One Page Number Twenty : Strange Writings contains descriptions of twenty tomes, pages, and scrolls, each with a minor hook or story attached. Reading is fundamental!

The One Page series gives the GM instant access to random tables full of woodland landmarks, strange objects, minor treasures, clever traps, and more! Each One Page product contains twenty unique, system-neutral entries in ready-to-roll format. Each entry can be easily adapted to any fantasy role-playing game.

164004.name: Blood Mystic
164004.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood mystic are doubly gifted - their blood carries a connection to both the arcane and divine. This allows them to delve into a breadth of power unavailable to almost anyone else. Blood mystics feel that the distinction between arcane and divine is largely meaningless, for tasks impossible to a mighty cleric or wizard comes naturally to them.

Prestige Class: Mystic theurge.
Build Classes: Oracle, sorcerer.

Role: The blood mystic has a unique palette of powers, and is able to both support her party and control the battlefield. Skimming across such a wide array of abilities forces the blood mystic to make many hard choices, both between what powers to seek in their blood and in how to use those powers.

164005.description:
Sometimes when a family moves into a new house, it's not the best place to live. It does, however, turn out to be the best place to stay forever...

Darkness Comes is a co-operative board game that tells a story of a family trying to escape from a haunted house. The game begins quickly. The set-up is gamified as the players use their cards to create the initial situation on the board. They decide which areas are haunted and which doors are closed, how much time they need to escape, where they can find useful items, what they should do before leaving the place. Every card they play increases the tension, and strange things start to happen: Menacing shadows gather, and family members' faces disappear from photographs. All these events prepare us for the forthcoming nightmare.

Then the main phase of the game begins. The house tries to ensnare the characters inside or kill them. Trying to find their way out, the family members encounter many kinds of horrors. Every time it happens, they decide whether to strengthen the house, hurt themselves, or change their plans.

Characters co-operate and support each other by transferring love points — but sometimes they have to risk their sanity to survive. And sometimes they lose their minds. That's why the rules of the game can change. The possessed character may decide to side with the sinister house. It comes as no surprise for horror fans when the father of the family gets mad and finds the axe!
164005.name: Darkness Comes: The Board Game

164006.description:
Chance and Strategy for the whole family!

This game is about trying to place more money in your bank than your opponents!

Rules are simple and the game is easy to play. At the same time, game is fun to play over and over.


The Thief steal from one's bank.
The Banker steal cards from one's hand.
Exchange hands if you dare!
If you have the King in your hand, stop your attacker! Unless he has a King too!


Strategically play your Action Cards or your Coin Cards! Make sure to be the last player to play!
164006.name: Thieves of coins
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

164007.name: Runemaster
164007.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




The game-story is to be based on Norse mythology, and the game will feature procedurally generated content. The game is set to include six of the nine worlds of Norse Mythology: Midgård, Jotunheim, Muspelheim, Helheim, Alfheim & Svartalfheim.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runemaster_%28video_game%29 Runemaster (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

164008.name: WiLD (PS4)
164008.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN DEVELOPMENT




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.




User Summary

WiLD is a survival adventure game devoted to the wilderness and is set 10,000 years ago. Every creature even the giant and dangerous ones are playable. The game has fantasy elements like shape-shifting.

164009.name: Zombotron 2
164009.description:
User Summary

Crash landed on an alien planet, you must fight enemies and make your way back to your own home. Explore the alien land and gather money and other equipment. Buy medicine chests, ammo and new weapons.

164010.description:
The year is 1891, and the city is London. The Napoleon of Crime, Professor Moriarty, has planned out a series of fantastic heists that will grant him untold fortune and power. However, he knows that the brilliant detective, Sherlock Holmes, has caught on to his plans and is trying to sabotage them! Prepared for this possibility, he has hired all his henchmen through intermediaries and hidden himself among them. Who will be discovered first: Sherlock or Moriarty?

Moriarty's Machinations is a party deduction game for 5-10 players. Each player starts with a unique role card, and which roles are in the game depends on how many players there are. Each role has different information about the other players.

Phase 1: Information Exchange
At the start of the game, a script is read to inform each player of their privileged knowledge about some of the other players.

Phase 2: Heists
Players take turns selecting crew members to go on Heists. If the majority of the table approves, then that crew goes on a Heist. Each crew member is given a set of Heist Cards. Cops can choose to Foil the Heist, and it only takes one cop to successfully do so. If no Cops Foil the Heist, then the points are awarded to the Robbers. Otherwise the Cops get the points.

Phase 3: Accusation
Once one team has reached the required point total, the Accusation phase begins. Jack the Ripper and Inspector Lestrade reveal their roles publicly and try to guess who the leader of the opposing team is. If they guess correctly, their team wins. If they tie, then the win is based on Heist points.
164010.name: Moriarty's Machinations

164011.name: Visual Brainstorms
164011.description:
The Smart Thinking Game

Welcome to Visual Brainstorms!
Assembled herein you will find 100 of the worlds best brainteaser puzzle cards, each one guaranteed to challenge, entertain, captivate, amuse and enlighten you.

For one or two players and teams. Fire questions at each other until the round is over...team with the highest score wins!

164012.name: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 3
164012.description:
The game has 80 playable characters (81 playable characters in Full Burst) including several new, making it the largest cast in the Ultimate Ninja series. The fighting system has been modified,with the Awakening Mode, a state that gave each character enhanced abilities when their health was low, being possible to be used at anytime during a fight, for certain characters. As in the previous games, the player can choose two characters to assist the player character in battle. The assisting characters now can also aid the playable one through the use of thirteen different types of combos. Additionally, the assistants have health bars, losing health whenever they get hit, ultimately being unusable when their health bars deplete. Several arenas have become interactive, making the player automatically lose a fight if they leave a specific area -
- Wikipedia;
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naruto_Shippuden:_Ultimate_Ninja_Storm_3

164014.name: Style Savvy: Trendsetters
164014.description:
Style Savvy: Trendsetters is a fashion store management simulation game which primarily involves selecting clothing pieces for customers as per their needs. The game's city is accessed from an ever-expanding map, allowing players to access their apartment, purchase new clothes and accessories, change their hairstyle and makeup, purchase new furniture, access their store, participate in competitions and access various locales with the purpose of activating certain events between characters. One addition to this sequel is the introduction of men's fashion.

The game also makes use of various 3DS features. An in-game screenshot function[4] is supported, allowing players to take photos of a scene from the top screen at any time, saving the image as a 3D screenshot. These screenshots can then be exported to the SD card. AR Photo Op is an additional mode which utilises the ? AR card packaged with the system to take augmented reality photographs using characters and props from the game. The Nintendo Network allows players to connect to the Fashion Plaza, where one can create and access others' Web Shops. A player's Web Shop allows them to customise a store front and create three outfits to sell to others, garnering additional money in-game. StreetPass is utilised to exchange Stylist Cards, which contains personalised information about your character and offers a link to the player's Web Shop. Using the Nintendo 3DS wireless local play, players can compete with up to three others in a Wireless Fashion Show which pits players against one another to create an outfit that best matches a particular theme or style.

from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Style_Savvy:_Trendsetters

164015.description:
Igramul the Banisher
Cost: 3 Crystals
Prestige Value: 7
Come-Into-Play Effect: Name a Card: Opponents reveal their hands and discard all copies of the named card. If at least one card was discarded, receive the energy present in that card's summoning cost.

This card was created by Federico Latini for a contest by Libellud. It was only included in the first printing of Seasons: Path of Destiny expansion.
164015.name: Seasons: Igramul the Banisher

164016.description:
Christina Regina is a card game version of Christina Regina - the Board Game. It is a game about politics and intrigues in 17th century Sweden where each player represents a faction with a hidden agenda. The end of their intrigues is the newly appointed queen Christina of Sweden and their means include persuasion, agitation, manipulation and even assassination. They achieve this by carefully steering the queen towards influence of their own faction and away from influence of other factions. At the same time, they must closely monitor the other players' actions to guess their agendas. But beware, if your own agenda is too obvious, you may yourself become the victim of your opponents' intrigues!
Game mechanisms include:
1. Card drawing: Cards are drawn or discarded so that each new player in turn is faced with new options.
2. Asymmetric scoring: There are no "good" or "bad" cards but they all score differently for different players.
3. Hidden agendas: The players do not know how much the other players score until the very end.
4. Guessing game: Based on how players play, the other players may gain points by guessing their agendas (or lose points by guessing wrong).

Christina Regina is the third game in the Nova Suecia series.
164016.name: Christina Regina: The Card Game

164017.name: Dinosaur Race
164017.description:
Match, count, and race your dinosaur to the finish line.

An exciting game where all the dinosaurs move simultaneously towards the finish line. Each turn, a four-arrowed roulette is spun and each of the players has to look at their result and find how many matching dinosaur tokens they have. Then all players move simultaneously their resulting number in the circuit. Afterwards, all the drawn dinosaur tokens are returned to the pool while turning them upside down, so a different pool is configured and next turn can start.

Race for your position on the podium to collect a shiny medal!

164018.name: Het grote erger je wel voetbalspel
164018.description: During which match did Hans Kraay Jr. throw away his jacket? Which Dutch player was among the top goal scorers during the World Cup 2010? These are some of over 450 questions in this unique football game. Test your football knowledge in general, but also related to events from the most popular football show on Dutch television. Play as Wilfred, Renee, Johan or Jan and answer questions about the following categories: Star players, WC football and more! And don't forget to annoy your opponents. Have a good match!

164019.name: Bathysphere
164019.description:
In the deepest depths of the ocean lie scientific discoveries yet to me made, ancient mysteries still to be solved and vast treasures to be gained by those willing to take the greatest risks. But it will take a brave soul to challenge the crushing pressure and terrors to be found at the bottom of the ocean.

Come aboard the fantastical Nautilus and meet her intrepid crew and the brave Captain Nemo, as they risk their lives for fame, fortune and glory - 20,000 Leagues under the sea.

Bathysphere is a 24 card microgame played across several rounds with each player having an opportunity to be Captain of the Nautilus.

Each turn players simultaneously vote whether to Descend (dive deeper), Ascend (return to the surface) or Abandon Ship! (leave in an escape pod with a small share). Majority rules.

After the vote the Nautilus dives and may face many dangers or crises by turning over a dive card. The crew may elect to use their skills and fix these crises or let them pass, however, if 3 crises go unresolved, Nautilus is destroyed and all hands lost to the crushing depths. Resolving a crisis places it back in the dive deck, meaning it may resurface again.

The deeper Nautilus and her crew travel, the greater the rewards but the greatest rewards are shared only with those demonstrating the most loyalty to the Captain.

164020.name: Musketeers: The Search for the Queen's Gems
164020.description:
Queen Anne has given her precious gems to The Duke of Buckingham, with whom she is secretly in love.

But Cardinal Richelieu, the most powerful man in France, is aware of the Queen’s affections and has convinced the King to hold gala fete where the Queen may show-off her dazzling gems – a gift from the oblivious King Louis.

In desperation, the Queen calls upon her valiant Musketeers and loyal servants to come to her aid – to find and return the gems to her before Richelieu and his nefarious spies can find them and reveal her to the King.

Musketeers: The Search for the Queen's Gems is a social deduction/bluffing 24-card microgame where 4-8 players assume an alliance on one of two sides – the Cardinalists or the Musketeers, each vying to outwit, outmanoeuvre and out-bluff each other to be the first group to collect together all four of the Queen’s gems and return them safely to the Queen, or to present them to the King.

164022.description:
On To Paris! uses a wargame system adapted from Victory Games' “The Civil War” to simulate the grand events of the Franco Prussian war (1870-71) and challenge players to control the leadership, organization and military operations of Armies and Corps during the later 19th century.

On To Paris! simulates both phases of the Franco Prussian war; the German invasion of France in 1870 and the German conquest of France in 1871. Designed for two players, On To Paris! is also suitable for solitaire play. Nine scenarios include an ‘early start’ plus a full length campaign game. Players can also pick any scenario as a starting point and determine their own period of the conflict to simulate.

On To Paris! is a fast moving competitive one map game where players do their best to control their forces and where every decision creates excitement and tension. The game system features interactive game play with flexible initiative and variable turn length as well as extensive defensive player reaction ability. The game puts players in charge of all the famous Corps and Army leaders of the Franco Prussian war which are all rated for their individual leadership qualities and occasional unique characteristics like resistance to following orders.
164022.name: On To Paris!

164023.name: Eyes Only
164023.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amy miró hacia atrás una vez más para asegurarse de que nadie le seguía. Cruzó la calle rápidamente con la tenue luz de las farolas proporcionándole más luz de la que necesitaba, dadas las circunstancias. Le gustaría dirigir su diestra hacia su pistola, pero tenía las manos ocupadas con aquél extravagante reloj de cuco. Parecía increíble que Milo Braschi, un loco quemado en la hoguera hace cientos de años por herejía, creara los diseños para un artefacto como ése. Se decía que incluso podía predecir la muerte de quién lo poseía.

Una figura surgió de entre las sombras y observó como la agente de La Agencia entraba en el edificio. Se inclinó sobre el cuello de su camisa y murmuró para el micrófono que llevaba dos palabras: “Así comienza”. En ese mismo instante el cuco del reloj comenzó a cantar, quizás porque había llegado la medianoche. Y justo entonces el edificio explotó con Amy en su interior...

Agencias gubernamentales. Organizaciones criminales. Mil agentes amateur repartidos por el globo esperando una llamada. Creyentes religiosos. Templarios. Eyes Only es un juego de rol de espionaje, intriga y acción frenética en el que los jugadores interpretan a agentes de alguna de las múltiples organizaciones que pueblan el globo persiguiendo sus propios objetivos y tratando de averiguar una verdad que nunca es lo que parece.

Pero éste es mucho más que un juego de espías. Eyes Only reproduce todo el sabor de las series de televisión que nos fascinan hoy día, e incorpora recursos narrativos y reglas que te permitirán trasladar la forma de narrar historias desde la televisión hasta tu mesa de juego: ¡Estructura por Temporadas, uso de flashbacks, flashfowards, cliffhangers y preludios narrativos y sistema de acción basado en Tomas son sólo algunos ejemplos de todas las posibilidades que se despliegan ante ti!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Amy looked back once more to make sure no one was following him. He crossed the street quickly with the dim light of the street lamps providing more light than needed, given the circumstances. I would direct your right hand towards his gun, but had his hands full with that fancy cuckoo clock. It seemed incredible that Milo Braschi, crazy burned at the stake for heresy hundreds of years ago, created the designs for a device like that. It was said that could even predict who died possessed.

A figure emerged from the shadows and watched as the agent of the Agency entered the building. He leaned over the collar of his shirt and muttered to the microphone wearing two words: "So begins". At that moment the cuckoo clock started singing, perhaps because he had come midnight. And just then the building exploded with Amy inside ...

Government agencies. Criminal organizations. Amateur thousand agents spread across the globe waiting for a call. Religious believers. Templars. Eyes Only is an RPG espionage, intrigue and frantic action in Players agents interpret some of the many organizations that populate the globe pursuing their own goals and trying to find a truth that is never what it seems .

But this is much more than a spy game. Eyes Only reproduce the flavor of the TV shows that fascinate us today, and incorporates narrative resources and rules that allow you to move the way of narrating stories from television to your table Game: Seasons Structure, using flashbacks, flashfowards, preludes and cliffhangers and narrative action system based on Tomas are just some examples of the possibilities that will come your way!

164024.name: Eyes Only: Así Comienza
164024.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amy miró hacia atrás una vez más para asegurarse de que nadie le seguía. Cruzó la calle rápidamente con la tenue luz de las farolas proporcionándole más luz de la que necesitaba, dadas las circunstancias. Le gustaría dirigir su diestra hacia su pistola, pero tenía las manos ocupadas con aquél extravagante reloj de cuco. Parecía increíble que Milo Braschi, un loco quemado en la hoguera hace cientos de años por herejía, creara los diseños para un artefacto como ése. Se decía que incluso podía predecir la muerte de quién lo poseía.

Una figura surgió de entre las sombras y observó como la agente de La Agencia entraba en el edificio. Se inclinó sobre el cuello de su camisa y murmuró para el micrófono que llevaba dos palabras: “Así comienza”. En ese mismo instante el cuco del reloj comenzó a cantar, quizás porque había llegado la medianoche. Y justo entonces el edificio explotó con Amy en su interior...

Agencias gubernamentales. Organizaciones criminales. Mil agentes amateur repartidos por el globo esperando una llamada. Creyentes religiosos. Templarios. Eyes Only es un juego de rol de espionaje, intriga y acción frenética en el que los jugadores interpretan a agentes de alguna de las múltiples organizaciones que pueblan el globo persiguiendo sus propios objetivos y tratando de averiguar una verdad que nunca es lo que parece.

Eyes Only: Así comienza es el capítulo piloto, la carta de presentación del nuevo juego de espías de Nosolorol Ediciones. Útil como kit de iniciación o primera aproximación para jugadores indecisos, Así comienza tiene todo lo necesario para empezar a jugar: Una breve introducción al mundo del espionaje, reglas de juego, incluyendo creación de personajes y combate, ejemplos de dispositivos y un pequeño escenario para empezar a jugar de inmediato. ¡Todo en 20 páginas!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Amy looked back once more to make sure no one was following him. He crossed the street quickly with the dim light of the street lamps providing more light than needed, given the circumstances. I would direct your right hand towards his gun, but had his hands full with that fancy cuckoo clock. It seemed incredible that Milo Braschi, crazy burned at the stake for heresy hundreds of years ago, created the designs for a device like that. It was said that could even predict who died possessed.

A figure emerged from the shadows and watched as the agent of the Agency entered the building. He leaned over the collar of his shirt and muttered to the microphone wearing two words: "So begins". At that moment the cuckoo clock started singing, perhaps because he had come midnight. And just then the building exploded with Amy inside ...

Government agencies. Criminal organizations. Amateur thousand agents spread across the globe waiting for a call. Religious believers. Templars. Eyes Only is an RPG espionage, intrigue and frantic action in Players agents interpret some of the many organizations that populate the globe pursuing their own goals and trying to find a truth that is never what it seems .

Eyes Only: So begins is the pilot episode, the letter of the new spy game Nosolorol Editions. Useful as a starter kit or first approximation for undecided players, so begins has everything you need to start playing: A brief introduction to the world of espionage, game rules, including character creation and combat, examples of devices and a small stage for start playing immediately. All in 20 pages!

164025.name: Lealtades Encontradas
164025.description:
From publisher blurb:

El 26 de abril de 1986 Rusia se vio sacudida por dos catástrofes. La primera fue conocida por todos como la catástrofe de Chernobyl, pero la segunda… la segunda sólo es conocida por un hombre, Penrod Steindel, y se suponía que había muerto hace años.

Cuando Die Tempelritter averigua que Steindel sigue vivo inicia una persecución por el erudito y sus secretos. ¿Qué estaban investigando Steindel y su equipo en el búnker B047? ¿Cuál era la relación de sus estudios con La Revelación? ¿Por qué ha pasado tantos años huyendo de sus propios compañeros? Estáis a punto de averiguarlo.

Lealtades encontradas es un capítulo autoconclusivo para Eyes Only escrito por Pedro J. Ramos, autor del juego, en el que los protagonistas deberán decidir entre el deber, lo que es justo, sus aprecios… y la propia supervivencia.

En este libro encontrarás:

Una historia que nos sumerge en los secretos de La Revelación e introduce un nuevo y peligroso elemento para que puedas emplearlo en tus Series
Cinco personajes pregenerados con historiales completos y preparados específicamente para participar en esta historia.
Aplicaciones prácticas e integradas en la historia de dos recursos narrativos: in media res y la historia dentro de la historia.
Consejos para narrar una historia de Los Templarios, incluso empleando únicamente Eyes Only: Así comienza. ¡No necesitarás ni el manual básico para ponerte a jugar!
Vacua Venganza,una aventura adicional desarrollada y prácticamente lista para su uso, en la que los protagonistas saldarán cuentas con El Tigre Unido.
Contenidos adicionales: directrices para que los jugadores puedan enriquecer su experiencia con los recursos narrativos propuestos por su Director de Juego.





Translation courtesy of Google:

On April 26, 1986 Russia was rocked by two disasters. The former was known by all as the Chernobyl disaster, but the second ... the second is known only by a man, Penrod Steindel, and was supposed to have died years ago.

When Die Tempelritter Steindel still alive learns that starts a chase by the scholar and secrets. What were investigating Steindel and his team in the bunker B047? What was the relationship of his studies with Revelation? Why has spent so many years running from their peers? You are about to find out.

Loyalties found a autoconclusivo Eyes Only chapter written by Pedro J. Ramos, author of the game, where players must decide between duty, what is right, their appreciations ... and survival.

In this book you will find:

A story that takes us into the secrets of Revelation and enter a new and dangerous element so you can use it in your Series
Five pre-generated characters with complete records and specifically prepared to participate in this story.
Practices and integrated into the story of two narrative devices Applications: in medias res and the story within the story.
Tips to narrate a history of the Templars, even using only Eyes Only: So begins.You will not need nor the primer to get playing!
Vacua Revenge, an additional adventure developed and almost ready for use, in which the protagonists be settled accounts with the Tiger Kingdom.
Additional: guidelines for players to enrich their experience with narrative resources proposed by the Director of the Game.

164026.name: Otro Tiempo
164026.description:
From publisher blurb:

¡El primer oneshot de Eyes Only ya está aquí!

Otro tiempo es una historia autoconclusiva para un Director de Juego y cuatro personajes jugadores ambientada en la misteriosa organización Acción Global. Los personajes, miembros de la organización, tendrán que esclarecer el robo producido en un laboratorio en Bolonia a la vez que participan de una historia acaecida en otro tiempo. ¡Dos historias en una!

Otro tiempo incluye:

Cuatro personajes pregenerados totalmente involucrados en la historia.
Dos historias entrelazadas por medio de recursos narrativos. ¡Olvídate del clásico planteamiento – nudo – desenlace!
Un misterio que ni siquiera el Director de Juego sabrá cómo resolver hasta el mismo momento en que se produzca.




Pedro J. Ramos, autor de Eyes Only, nos brinda en Otro tiempo la primera oportunidad de jugar una historia completamente integrada dentro del trasfondo de este juego de espionaje. Unoneshot muy especial, pues se trata de una edición limitada no disponible en tiendas.


Translation courtesy of Google:

The first oneshot Eyes Only is here!

Another Time is a story for a autoconclusiva Game Director and four players characters set in the mysterious organization Global Action. The characters, members of the organization will have to clarify the theft occurred in a laboratory in Bologna while participating in a once happened in history.Two stories in one!

Another time includes:

Four pre-generated characters fully involved in the story.
Two interwoven stories through narrative devices.Forget the classic approach - knot - outcome!
A mystery that even the Game Master will know how to solve the same time that it occurs.




Pedro J. Ramos, author of 'Eyes Only', Another time gives us the first opportunity to play a fully integrated within the background of this spy game history. Unoneshot very special because it is a limited edition not available in stores.

164027.description:
Mesopotamia in the year 4000 BC. Along the banks of the rivers Euphrates and Tigris, the first advanced civilization of mankind is prospering. The Sumerian people are known as the cradle of human civilization. They were the first tribe to develop writing and many more achievements. In Uruk II, players are travelling back to the time of the first civilizations. Each player develops their own people over a period of five epochs, aiming to gain achievements and to set up villages and towns. Uruk II – The development continues is the newest addition to the line of Uruk-games. It is based on the rules of Uruk – Cradle of Civilization but many enhancements will provide a completely new and exciting gaming experience.

Game Components: 147 playing cards, 5 summary cards, 130 wooden tokens, 1 rule book, several leaflets with general information.

Mesopotamien im Jahre 4000 v. Chr. Die erste Hochkultur der Menschheit entwickelt sich entlang der beiden Flüsse Euphrat und Tigris. Das Volk der Sumerer gilt als Ursprung der menschlichen Zivilisation, das als erstes eine Schrift entwickelte und viele weitere Errungenschaften hervorbrachte. In Uruk II tauchen die Spieler in die Zeit der ersten Hochkulturen ein. Jeder Spieler entwickelt sein eigenes Volk über insgesamt fünf Epochen. Es gilt, Errungenschaften zu machen sowie Dörfer und Städte zu gründen. Uruk II – Die Entwicklung geht weiter ist ein neues Spiel aus der Uruk-Familie, das auf den Mechanismen von „Uruk – Wiege der Zivilisation“ basiert und diese konsequent zu einem vollkommen neuen Spielerlebnis weiterentwickelt. Neben zahlreichen neuen Mechanismen wurde Uruk II komplett grafisch neu gestaltet und mit individuellen Holzteilen üppig ausgestattet.

Material: 147 Spielkarten, 5 Übersichtskarten, 130 Holzteile, 1 Spielregel, diverse Faltblätter mit Übersichten
164027.name: Uruk II: Die Entwicklung Geht Weiter
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 12 – Three Kingdoms Redux

164028.name: Optional Skill Resolution Rules
164028.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Can my fighter sneak up on the goblin?"
"Can my magic-user convince the captain of the guard to let us into the dungeon?"

"Can my cleric jump over that wall?"

Answer these questions and more with Optional Skill Resolution Rules. Simple, flexible, and narrative, OSR2 gives players tools to customize their characters. Make up a fighter who's knowledgeable about ancient civilizations, a druid who's a skilled lady's man, a thief who's light on his feet, and so much more.

164029.name: Abe-X
164029.description:
From publisher blurb:

"GRRRRRRRRR"

The Theta Files provide illustrations, game stats, and background for heroes and villains you can drop directly into your 3rd edition Mutants & Masterminds campaign. Abe-X is PL 10 cyborg with a primal temper!

164030.name: Crypts & Creatures Advanced Players Guide
164030.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever needed more options than just another dwarven fighter or elven wizard. With the Advanced Players Guide you'll have the edge that you need to enjoy your Crypts & Creatures game like never before

Four new races (Half-Ogre, Lizardman, Tiefling, and Aasimar)
Three new classes (Anti-Paladin, Oracle, and Witch/Warlock)
Two optional rules

164031.description:
Munchkin Steampunk Deluxe adds gears, goggles, and steam-powered robots to the backstabbing and goofy humor of the long-lived card game Munchkin, a game in which you kick down doors, battle monsters, gain treasure, and try to reach level ten before anyone else.

Munchkin Steampunk Deluxe is a standalone game, but it can be integrated with any Munchkin game or expansion.
164031.name: Munchkin Steampunk

164033.name: Just Add Ice SportACTION Hockey Card Game
164033.description:
"A fast paced card game that has all the action of real hockey game. It's a race to assemble your team. Player trades and recruits allowed but, watch out for penalties and flying pucks!" -- From The Manufacturer

Using a card drawing mechanic, players attempt to complete their "team,"by assembling player cards for each position (of the same color). Different cards represent the different positions -- Offense, Defense, and Goalie, as well as special cards which cause different game effects, and wild cards which can replace other player cards on your "team."

164034.name: History: Legends of War
164034.description: User Summary: History: Legends of War is a turn-based military strategy game, taking the player from beaches of Normandy to Berlin. There is 21 missions in the game (single player), and 44 battlefield maps (online multiplayer). The player can use 36 different types of units, including infantry, snipers, vehicles and aircrafts. The aim is to beat the Nazi forces.

164035.name: The Assassin: A Dungeon World Class
164035.description:
From publisher blurb:

They say your trade is the second oldest there is. You can't be sure, but you see no reason to doubt them: in your experience, there are always people willing to exchange money for murder. Power, conviction, cruelty, wealth—all end equally at the point of a knife. All it takes is a simple transaction.

And, inevitably, the knife is in your hand.

You know weakness by instinct, weapons by weight, shadows by sound and the dying curses of your victims by heart. You wield the magic of the streets, of shadows and of blood. You do your job with professional dispassion and expect to be paid in full for services rendered.

Contracts are always plentiful. Time to get to work.

The Assassin is a new class for use with Dungeon World - a lethal killer with a mastery of shadow magic, partly inspired by the video game Dishonored. It also includes:

The City Thief, a variant of Sage LaTorra and Adam Koebel's Thief class from the Dungeon World core book, which loses the poison moves for some more stealth- and agility-oriented moves and is inspired by the Thief video game series.

And new items like the water arrow or flash bombs, also inspired by Thief!

164036.name: Red Aegis
164036.description:
From the Core Book's Forward

Welcome to an epic, millennia-spanning, strategic roleplaying game where you claim your birthright, rally loyal followers to your cause, and forge a dynasty to stand the test of time. During a RED AEGIS campaign, your decedents, called scions, will lead successive generations from the setting's ancient past to the far future from axe-wielding savages to planetary soldiers packing gravity hammers, and everything in between. Choose your flavor of dominance through aggressive conflict, crafty subterfuge, or spiritual supremacy.

RED AEGIS is about making difficult choices. These decisions will impact not only your tribe's future, but also the fate of your descendants and the world they inhabit.

The stories that emerge from playing RED AEGIS are a direct result of your unique exploits while traversing through time.

We would like to give a special thank you to our cadre of associate game designers. They have been instrumental in ironing out the kinks in the alpha version of this document. Each of them is a great asset to this team and their input has been invaluable.

From the Core Book's Introduction

RED AEGIS is a game that at once feels both familiar and unique indeed, it is a curious fusion of traditional tabletop roleplaying and 4X turn-based strategy games. In RED AEGIS, players assume the role of clan scions the would-be champions of their age. Together, the players must unite the disparate clans into a cohesive tribe to thwart a looming peril that threatens to scour their civilization from the history books.

RED AEGIS combines the fast, tactical gameplay of a boardgame with the narrative storytelling and worldbuilding of traditional roleplaying games. The campaign plays out over nine game sessions, each set in a time period more advanced than the last. By the final session, thousands of years will have passed, seeing your tribe advance from primitive hunter-gatherers to a spacefaring civilization colonizing the stars.

Reflecting back upon your campaign, you'll discover a vibrant game world, its unique history and cultures designed entirely from the imaginations of you and your fellow players. That's the real secret of RED AEGIS.

164037.name: DragonFire
164037.description:
From publisher blurb:

DRAGONFIRE!

Once a fan of martial arts movies, DragonFire is now a master of the deadly dark chi! Merged with an ancient creature of evil, he now feeds off chi energy to grow more powerful and eventually be the master of all chi in the world!

164038.name: Aboleth
164038.description:
From publisher blurb:

An alternative way to enjoy The Lazy GM. Maybe you need a monster for a campaign but don't want to buy a large collection. The Lazy GM Single Shots take a single monster and give variant Hit Dice, templates, builds and class levels for both Pathfinder and traditional 3.5 OGL, for a bargain price.

Aboleths features material previously found in The Lazy GM: Freaks and Horrors, but adds 3.5 stats and a few new builds, including half-fiend and devil-bound versions, and the 3.5 psion, to give 30 pages of aboleths ready to drop into a campaign, plus suggestions on how to use them in an adventure.

A fully clickable index cross-referenced by CR and templates, plus bookmarks, means you can easily find just what you need.

164039.name: Ankheg
164039.description:
From publisher blurb:

An alternative way to enjoy The Lazy GM. Maybe you need a monster for a campaign but don't want to buy a large collection. The Lazy GM Single Shots take a single monster and give variant Hit Dice, templates, builds and class levels for both Pathfinder and traditional 3.5 OGL, for a bargain price.

Ankheg features material previously found in The Lazy GM: Dungeon Beasts, but adds a few new builds, including the winged ankheg and the lava beetle.

A fully clickable index cross-referenced by CR and templates, plus bookmarks, means you can easily find just what you need.

164040.name: Campus Blocks
164040.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 30 inch Battlemap of a City Campus at a scale of 20 feet per inch, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“Homework was never like this in high school.”

The product is a single map of an outside view of a college campus with a quarter circular shape.

The product is intended for use in modern settings.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Extracurricular Activities: Most people join campus clubs for fun. But what the other students don’t know is that you joined the fencing or archery clubs to improve your aim, precision, and accuracy for deadly serious reasons. The campus is a normal college campus by day. But at night, the place crawls with creatures of the night. Vampires, werewolves, demons, all stalk the college campus looking for meals. You and your closest confidants have banded together to fight these creatures and keep the campus safe. Making the task even more difficult is the need to keep your grades up at the same time. Can you and your fellow students survive, find the source of these creatures and their connection to the campus, and still get good enough marks to graduate?

164041.name: Cosmopolite
164041.description:
From publisher blurb:

Civilisations stand and fall, not by might of arms, but by its cosmopolites – the ordinary Citizens and Scholars who make up most of the population.

Book 10: Cosmopolite provides new options and possibilities for characters who have followed the Citizen or Scholar careers. Citizens and Scholars together are keepers of the flame of civilisation.

With this book, your Citizen character will be able to build Networks, a web of Allies, Contacts and Patrons that can be called upon at any time, while Scholar characters can approach their own societies and fellowships for funding and resources accessible only to scientists.

Your characters can now attend University or Medical School, and try a brand new career choice, the Teacher. You will learn how to continue your research, even while you travel the galaxy, publishing papers that push the boundaries of known science.

The referee is provided with all the support material he will need for Citizens and Scholars, from organisations that can act as adventure hooks or Patrons, to scientific questions that have stumped Scholars across Known Space and are now available for players to tackle!

Far from being simple white or blue collar workers, or unassuming librarian types, Book 10: Cosmopolite contains everything you need to make Citizens and Scholars among the most exciting careers to play in Traveller.

164042.name: Rally Point Volume 8: Sons of the Rising Sun
164042.description: A special study of the Pacific Theater of Operations. It includes 10 new scenarios from the Tampa ASL Group. This special study of the PTO is intended to compliment the ASL module Rising Sun by providing players with tournament-level scenarios designed with the modern-era style of ASL play in mind.

164043.name: The Twilight Saga 3 Game Collection
boardgamecompilation: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse – The Movie Board Game
The Twilight Saga: New Moon – The Movie Board Game
164043.description: From the box: "Enter the world of the Twilight Saga with this collection of games based on the epic movie series. The more you know about Bella, Edward, Jacob, the Saga movies & your friends, the better your chance of winning. Combine all three games for the ultimate Twilight Saga experience."

164044.name: Borscht!
164044.description:
Borscht! is a set collection and strategy card game for 3-4 players ages 8 and up.

Players become Cossack peasants competing to complete a pot of traditional borscht (beet soup) while fending off the marauding tartars and sandy mole rats. In this society, economy is king--the Cossack with the cheapest borscht wins.

Game components include 101 Borscht! cards, 4 action and recipe cards,4 player identification cards, 20 coins in an old sock, and a six-sided die.

Each character identity has special abilities (such as the "Baboushka" (wise woman) whose negotiating skills allow her to buy commodities below market value. After all players have used their identities, the cards are rotated, creating a new balance of power in the game.

164047.name: Super Blue and Gray
164047.description: This game fuses the game Blue and Gray with checkers. In it, players attempt to navigate their Captain piece to the middle, moving along a winding road on the board to be the first to get their Captain to the middle of the board. In addition, players can promote their Private pieces to Sergeants, which adds backwards mobility to a Private.

164049.description:
The grand feast for the nest is tonight! A group of fancy rats are sent out into town to scavenge for the ingredients that are needed to make the feast a success. However, a cat and a ratcatcher are looking to catch the rats. Each rat has a special ability that can help ensure victory. With a little luck and some skill, the rats will find what they need in town, all the while wearing dapper hats, of course!

Players, as rats, collect Food cards to place in their buffets to complete Entrees given to them at the start of the game. To collect Food cards, players roll a die and move into different locations, such as a bakery or a butcher shop. There are five different types of food: Bread, Fruit, Meat, Vegetable, and Cheese. The different locations offer these types of Food. For example, when a rat enters the Cheese Shop, he or she draws a card from the Cheese deck. Or, when a rat enters the Pastry Shop, he or she draws a card from either the Bread deck OR the Fruit deck.

Then, the rats add cards to their buffets from their hands, but only one at a time. After that, the player switches into the role of the cat and/or ratcatcher. He or she rolls the Enemy die and moves the cat and/or ratcatcher accordingly. When the cat enters the same tile as a rat, he or she must discard a card in hand. When the ratcatcher enters the same tile as a rat, he or she must lose a card from his or her buffet. So, players can use the cat and ratcatcher to keep other rats in check if a player is getting too far ahead.

The game moves to a final turn when a player has ten Food cards in his or her buffet OR when any Food deck runs out of cards. Then, the player with the most points, when adding up all of his or her Entrees and Food cards, wins the game.
164049.name: Rats in Top Hats

164050.name: Knights & Damosels
164050.description:
Knights & Damosels takes you back to the Age of Chivalry and the intricate code of conduct between the King's men and the ladies of the court. In the game, the players play both knights and damosels from the Arthurian legend - each with his or her different objectives. As a knight, compete with the other knights to become the most noble of them all or cooperate in quests and battles to earn glory in the eyes of King Arthur. As a damosel, provide another knight with the arms and virtues he needs until he is wrapped around your finger. But beware, if the Land falls you will all fall with it!

Game mechanisms include:
1. Double deck building: The players build decks in two ways, different types (knights) or similar colors (damosels)
2. Hidden information: The damosel do not build their own deck but try to get cards of their (hidden) color to the same knight
3. Card placement: The players place cards to earn points but may only place cards not already placed by another player
4. Simultaneous actions: The success of an action depends on a player's ability to predict the card played of another player
5. Cooperation: The players fight wars and obtain quests together.
6. Prisoners' dilemma: One player may benefit by not cooperating but if all do so, all will lose.

164051.name: Troc•Sushi: Game of Bluff
164051.description:
A bluffing game where the aim is collect the most maki and sushi possible by bluffing.

Contents: 18 Fish cards numbered 0-3
Rule cards for 10 languages.
21 Maki tokens.
11 Sushi tokens.

The deck of cards are shuffled and the first player draws the top three cards and secretly
announces a score lower than or equal to 9.
There are then the 2 possibilities.

A.The following player believes the announced score and takes the cards, whilst the first player wins a maki tile.The following player then draws the top card from the draw deck and announces a score still lower or equal to 9.

B.The following player does not believe the score announced.
If the first players announced score was right he shows the cards, puts them beneath the draw deck and takes a maki tile. The following player then misses a turn.
The next player then draws 3 cards from the deck and play starts again.

If a player announces 9 without bluffing he wins 2 Maki tiles.

When a player has 5 maki tiles, he exchanges them for 1 sushi Tile.

Depending on the players and time available the winner of the game is the first to obtain 1 or 2 Sushi tiles.

164052.name: Nexopolis
164052.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Nexopolis!

Now go home!

Nexopolis sits on an island in the middle of a vast ocean, far from the sight of any distant shores. Here the weather is always perfect, except when there is a hurricane. Here nearly everyone comes from somewhere else, except for Finnian who runs but does not rule Nexopolis. Here you will find a crossroads of worlds, except these Doors all require Keys. Here you find a Justicar, but not much justice, except for that dealt out by private security teams and the Vigilance Committee. Here you will find both sophisticated magic and high technology, except buying might cost you more than money. Here a few reckless fools will try to reclaim parts of the rest of the world, except the Dwimmerlaik destroyed this world and the rest of the world is not ready for them yet.

164053.name: Mith'Varal
164053.description:
From publisher blurb:

The smithies of Mith’Varal once rung with the sounds of dwarven craftsmen working the precious mithral extracted from the nearby mines into arms and armour of incredible beauty. Now all but one smithy lies dusty and abandoned. The mines once guaranteeing the village’s wealth and power are all but exhausted and now give up only scraps of Mith’Varal’s silvery lifes-blood. Discontent and anger simmers among the populace – anger that the gods have abandoned the village and thegn Thorak Arnirsson does not stir himself from his bleak fortress to save his people. For now, the Faceless Guard guarantee the thegn’s rule, but their ruthlessness and the acts of a rebel group of miners delving deep in the closed mines, threaten to bring rebellion to Mith’Varal’s streets.

164054.name: The Murmuring Fountain (5E)
164054.description:
From publisher blurb:

A adventure both haunting and horrible for 1st-level characters!

At my window came a tapping...

Sometimes a raven not just a raven, and those who have lost everything may do more than come a-gently tapping upon your chamber door. A missing pet, a ghostly girl, a madman in the woods; what is the strand that binds them all together at The Murmuring Fountain? Can your heroes quell the ghostly emanations of a tragic haunting that threaten to sow madness and tragedy.

The Murmuring Fountain is an adventure for 1st-level characters using the 5th edition of the world's most famous roleplaying game. The adventure can be played on its own or in combination with The Fiddler's Lament, or as part of the beginning of a horror-themed Adventure Path campaign.

164055.name: The Fiddler's Lament (5E)
164055.description:
From publisher blurb:

A sinister song invites adventure for 1st-level characters with music fit to wake the dead!

Music hath charms to soothe the savage breast, it's true, but some music truly is the devil's music. An orphan raised by gypsies, now full-grown but still lost and alone, must face once more the tragic curse that destroyed her past. Will her darkling music bring ruin to the village she now calls her home? Can the heroes earn the townsfolk's trust, or must innocence be sacrificed for the heroes to save town from the mysterious hauntings that plague a village huddled in the shadow of an accursed ruin?

This dark fantasy adventure is perfect for 1st-level characters using the 5th edition of the world's most famous role-playing game. The adventure can be played on its own or in combination with The Murmuring Fountain, or as part of the beginning of a horror-themed Adventure Path campaign.

164056.name: Glitterdoom
164056.description:
From publisher blurb:

A level 3 adventure

Fifth Edition Fantasy is here! This adventure module is fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world’s most popular fantasy RPG, and ready to play in your home campaign!

Centuries ago, the glitterdoom came to the dwarves of Steelhand Clan! This divine curse transformed the dwarves into hellish forms with an insatiable greed for gold. Now, a chance encounter breaks open long-sealed gates to unleash the glitterdoom again. Can your adventurers delve into the forgotten halls to confront the subterranean menace?

This all-new 5E adventure module includes a new dwarf sub-race and a new PC background!

164057.name: The Fey Sisters' Fate
164057.description:
From publisher blurb:

A level 1 adventure

Fifth Edition Fantasy is here! This adventure module is fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world’s most popular fantasy RPG, and ready to play in your home campaign!

The cries of battle echo in the rustic wilderness, as a pair of fey sisters defend the ancient Briarwood against invaders. When the town of Bur Hollow sends militia men to support their fey allies, they disappear without a trace. The adventurers must enter the Briarwood and save them!

This all-new 5E adventure module includes two new spells and a new PC background!

164058.name: Ice Cold Ice Hockey: Junior Edition
164058.description: Designed for younger gamers, this "junior" version of Ice Cold Ice Hockey has a simpler action-card deck and a much smaller (4-page) rules set. The cards serve multiple purposes, including passing, skating, shooting, defense, shot-blocking and goaltending. Naturally, realistic shots on goal and save percentages have been retained from the original version, and both young and older players will be able to complete a game in about 30 exciting minutes.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Nominee
164059.description:
Miniatures skirmish game set during the Crusades (late Medieval).

From the Gripping Beast website:

"Full colour hardback book, 120 pages. Comes with 6 cardstock Battle Boards and a Quick Reference Sheet.

Contains full SAGA rules, details and rules for six new factions from the Age of The Crusades, new rules for Dogs of War units & Priests plus new scenarios."
164059.name: Saga: The Crescent and the Cross

164060.name: Tales from Dead Men
164060.description:
From the PDF:
The Island of Castonegro is part of a chain of uncharted islands called the Devil’s Hammer. Many pirates escape to this island when evading the Spanish fleet because it has a hidden cove, called the Bed of the Black Cat. This is where pirates can rest and resupply their ships for future conquests. A pirate’s haven of sorts, but it comes with a price. Every now and then there are tales of ships that stray from the normal safe sea lanes within the island chain and encounter things worse than the Spanish fleet. Those ships are never seen again. But then how can those tales be true if there are never any survivors and, as we know, dead men tell no tales.

Tales From Dead Men is for beginners. The scenario provides pre-generated characters at the back for ease of play, though the players may wish to create their own characters and ship, especially if they have a copy of Blood Tide.

164061.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Phaeris Promo
164061.description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game. 10.000 years and not a grey hair: Phaeris the Mighty is not a dragon to joke about. He has carried the sledge of the Purple Claws Archipelago for more than a month, alone against a full army! But this battle has exhausted him, and he now devotes himself to protect Yugo and his friends. It may be the first time in 10.000 years that a warrior could add a dragon to his body count.

164062.description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game.
164062.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Cleophee Promo

164063.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Percedal Promo
164063.description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game. Two-in-one brute: Handle the rank and file, Percedal takes care of the big fish!

164064.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Adamai Promo
164064.description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game. Offered through the Krosmaster: Quest Kickstarter.

164065.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Yugo Young King Promo
164065.description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game. Offered Through the Krosmaster: Quest preorder.

164066.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Qilby Promo
164066.description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game. Offered through the Krosmaster: Quest preorder.

164067.description:
These cards, with a size of 5"x7", are double the size of the normal player reference cards. They cover the miniatures and promos released as a part of the "Krosmaster: Arena - Season 2" line.

These cards are the same as the ones that come with the figures, but they are larger.
164067.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 – 2x cards

164068.name: Burst Class Gunship
164068.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The ship introduced in this installment of the series is a not jump capable 200 dT gunship.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

164069.name: Characters Unbound I: Player's Guide
164069.description:
From publisher blurb:

Million Faces, A Million Lies

“I’ve seen people freeze up, lose their minds screaming, faint dead away, or crap themselves while scrambling to try to get away. Falling apart like this can be fatal in the field. But nothing’s as bad as the ones I know who got so scared they went crazy.”

Anastasia paused, letting the room grow silent. “Scared yet?”

Several of the students actually had the guts to nod their heads. “Good. You’re the smart ones so far. Okay, so who here knows the mortality rate of Warden field agents?”

None of the students raised a hand. They were definitely paying attention now.

“That’s not something they tell you when you’re signing up. It’s 35% over two years. Think about that. Look around at everyone. One out of every three people in this room is going to be dead within twenty-four months.”

There it was. Someone broke out in a sniffle, trying not to cry. Several students simply stood and walked out. Anastasia didn’t look surprised at all. It was almost like this behavior was expected and on cue.

“Scared now?”

The Void is an original Lovecraftian hard sci-fi horror setting.

Character’s Unbound I: Player’s Guide:

Introduces Lifepath Character Generation, so you can build any kind of Character from the ground up.
Provides tools to help put more of The Void into your Character, including Character secrets.
Greatly expands the number of Character Talents, and introduces Advanced Talents and Team Talents.
Introduces optional rules for Character Empathy.
Provides new rules for Achievements, so you can get more for exploring the world of The Void.
Introduces optional rules for a more conglomerated skill system.

164070.description:
A set of 12 ships that all have the cloak ability. These ships are repaints of ships available through retail stores. They are painted to give the appearance they are cloaked.

The ship list is as follows:

D'Deridex
Defiant
Koranak
K'Vort/B'Rel
K'Tinga
Negh'Var
Romulan Bird of Prey (Gal Gath'thong)
Romulan Bird of Prey (Praetus)
Romulan Science Vessel
Romulan Scout Vessel
Valdore
Vor'cha
164070.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Cloaked Ship Pack

164071.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – DS9 Upgrade Card Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
164071.description:
A set of Character cards representing the crew of DS9.

Included are cards for the following personalities:

Benjamin Sisko
Elim Garak
Julian Bashir
Quark
Odo
Vic Fontaine
T'Kar
T'Rul

164072.description:
In Tenka: Shogun Edition, you will work to fill your Court with all of the tools necessary to rule Japan’s various provinces. Power can come from winning over Priests, lesser Lords, and Knights, or you can push for bringing Japan’s unique aspects to your side. No matter the direction you choose, you’ll be racing against time to restore order before Chaos breaks out.

Only one can seize enough Provinces or retrieve the Imperial Regalia (the three Sacred Treasures of Japan) to control the realm. Will it be you?
164072.name: Tenka: Shogun Edition

164073.description:
Patton’s Third Army is a solitaire game system where the player takes command of General George Patton’s Third Army during the campaign across France in 1944. The game begins immediately following the Falaise Battle and continues through to 15 December, at which point Third Army was sent to fight In the Battle of the Bulge. Your goal as a player is to surpass Patton’s original record, thereby possibly forestalling Germany’s Ardennes Offensive and thereby gaining glory as a great general.

In the game, you control US and other Allied units assigned to the Third Army. The game system plays the Germans. You will have to deal with a wide variety of situations, from battling against fierce panzer counterattacks, to figuring out ways to extend your lines of supply. Your objective: Germany!

The game has two levels: the Standard Rules, which gives a quick wargame, and the Optional Rules, which give more realism for more complexity.

While Patton’s Third Army is a solitaire game, multiple players can play as the US team, making decisions by consensus, or each managing operations along one of the “Axes of Advance”. However, one player should always be the Commander of Third Army, and his decision is final!
164073.name: Patton's Third Army

164074.name: Anel Elemental O Legado
164074.description:
Title translation: Elemental Ring - The Legacy

Summary translated from the Portuguese from a catalog description:

A Medieval Fantasy RPG where Knights and Mages coexist with Monsters and Dragons, set in the world Andora, created by the author, and uses a system of own rules, based on the open system Fudge ...

(Um Rpg de Fantasia Medieval Onde Cavaleiros e Magos Coexistem Com Monstros e Dragões, Possui Como Cenário o Mundo de Andora, Criado Pelo o Autor, e que Utiliza um Sistema de Regras Próprio, Baseado no Sistema Aberto Fudge...)

164076.name: Insight RPG System Add-on: Raging Seas
164076.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Insight RPG System Add-on covers rules for sailing ships, naval combat and seafaring in the Age of Sail. Become a pirate, pirate hunter, smuggler or merchant. Pick up your cutlass and set sails for new adventures!

This Add-on contains:

19 Ship descriptions
Rules for Upgrading/Improving ships
Naval Combat rules
New weapons
Skill descriptions
and more

164077.name: Magic & Flintlock
164077.description:
From the publisher:

Welcome to this new art free d100 system.

Why art free? Simply to keep the cost low and be able to offer a quality product that you all will enjoy.

How is this different from other d100 systems?

Well, it's a very familiar d100 system with some changes. What it does instead is take the basic Renaissance rules and add all kinds of content to it including, new rules, ships, magic systems and even a whole chapter on magic items!

So how is it different? Simple! Movement in metres is now determined by your characteristics rather than by a static number. As well, a new attribute for divine and spirit magic (Spirit) is introduced along with a whole new way of doing Divine and Sorcery magic that is new and refreshing. The magic item chapter will blow you away as well. Some of it may be familiar from the d20 SRD but the way it all works is new and will be enjoyable for sure.

AS WELL. A whole new expanded bestiary featuring old favourites from the d20 SRD, Legend and Renaissance along with a couple new ones.

This game is a complete RPG and requires nothing else for play making this quite possibly a one stop shop. Of course we hope it isn't and that you'll enjoy Magic & Flintlock products in the time to come!

164078.name: uperShoot ARENA
164078.description:
User Summary

Shoot the enemies before they shoot you. Move your ship around a fixed screen and shoot the enemies with bullets while avoiding being hit yourself.

164079.name: Burn Ball
164079.description:
User Summary

Select your team of top level athletes. You get to make a choice then the opposing AI makes a choice until each side has three players. Then you play dodge ball! Pick up the ball and throw it at opposing players. If you hit them, they are out. If one of your players is hit they are out. Try to win by eliminating all opposing players.

164080.name: Meepile: Box & Bits
164080.description:
A box you say? Yes, an official box for your Meepile!
Since the first edition of Meepile did not come in a box, we decided to create one. Yes, we've created a nice little home for your beloved Meepile. Now your Meepile no longer needs to be dusted before play, and can rest snuggly on the shelf, between your other Simi Game Knights small box games.

While we are at it, we might as well add some bits. Because you can never have too many bits.

Oh, and a few cards, because there was still a little room in the box.

How about a new way to play? Because you can never have too many ways to play with your Meepile.

Bits -
Each player has a collection of 6 interestingly shaped wooden bits to place on the Meepile. Each player also is given a deck of 6 cards that represents each of their 6 wooden bits. The cards are shuffled and on a player's turn one is revealed. The player then is required to place that piece.

As usual, all pieces knocked off of the Meepile are gathered into your stockpile, so if you turn over a card and you have more than one of the matching shaped bits, you may attempt to place all of them. Work your way through the 6 cards and then shuffle and start again, until someone has placed all of his/her stockpile and wins the round.

Additional way to use these bits and cards are included in the game box.

164081.name: Chicken Shoot 2
164081.description:
User Summary

A sleeping man wakes up and discovers chickens in his yard. Kill as many as you can. Shoot chickens in this zany game. Aim your cursor and fire. Collect items and score points. You can play Classic, and Arcade modes.

164082.name: Scram Kitty and his Buddy on Rails
164082.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Scram Kitty and his Buddy on Rails is a unique shooter-platformer, built by Dakko Dakko exclusively for Wii U™.

Take control of a rail-riding, laser-shooting young hero on a perilous quest to rescue his pet cat, Scram Kitty, kidnapped and imprisoned in the depths of the World's biggest orbiting space laboratory, along with all of Earth's cats.

Save the World?

Scram Kitty is at the mercy of an ever-expanding army of maniacal mechanized mice! You must use your magnetic Spinboard to ride energy rails deeper and deeper into the station and defeat the twisted mouse creations of a science experiment gone terribly wrong.

With a unique control system that allows for full 360-degree platforming action and thrilling 2D shooting, Scram Kitty and his Buddy on Rails will see you glide along glowing rails, leap across chasms and create arcing streams of shots as you rid each stage of its rodent aggressors and rescue all the cats imprisoned within.

Featuring...
Multi-objective stages
Distinctive weapons for ultimate destruction
Thousands of miserable mice minions to defeat
Gorgeous pixel graphics mixed into 3D worlds
A blistering original electro-synth soundtrack
Challenge Mode, for the truly dedicated

164083.name: Diggy Diggy Dice
164083.description:
An Old Dwarven Dice Game for 1 to a lot of players.

You are a dwarf and you are digging a hole. You want to gather up all the precious ores and gems without blowing yourself up (too much) or hitting a lava stream.

You start your digging with 0 points and 5 lives.

Roll 6 Dice 3 times. On each roll you can keep some, none or all of the dice
After the third roll you tally up your score.

Emeralds 10 points
Diamonds 5 points
Coal 2 points
Lapis 1/2 point

TNT: for each TNT loose one life but gain 10 points
(you blew up good but you also dislodged some precious gems)

Lava: for each Lava destroy the highest scoring Ore or Gem

If you loose all of your lives your score is reset to 0 and you are given 3 lives.
If you loose all your lives after that your score is reset to 0 and you are given 1 life.

The first digger to 300 wins.

Both the PrintAndPlay and Tabletop Simulator versions of Diggy Diggy Dice are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
(No dwarves were harmed in the making of this game. Please mine responsibly.)

164084.name: Air Desa
164084.description: A educational game used in development work in rural Indonesia. The game helps players to experience the holistic life value difference of living with clean water in a village instead of river water. Mechanics are simple, but players are challenged to overcome obstacles of finance, education, and enjoyment while dealing with life-threatening illnesses.

164086.description:
From the box:

"Super Story War is a hilarious party game where 3 to 8 players battle each other by telling stories, referencing pop culture, and making stuff up!

Play as a character like a Pirate, a Detective or a Mad Scientist. Each card is only as powerful as the story you build around it. No numbers, no dice, just your imagination!

Super Story War is designed to be played on its own, but the cards can be shuffled with other volumes of Story War for even crazier match-ups!"

In each round of play, one player is considered to be the Judge. The Judge draws a Battlefield card, that determines where the battles will take place. The other players split into teams, and play Warrior cards from their hand onto the table. Then the battle commences, with players on each team using their imagination to tell the Judge why their warriors would win in a fight against their opponents, or how they would defend against their opponents' attacks. Examples from the rulebook:

"Police Dog reads you your rights!"

"But the Ninja vanishes into the shadows!"

The Judge is the final arbiter of what is and isn't permissible, and also decides any challenges. Players can also use Item cards from their hand to add more collateral to the fight ("Alien uses this Jetpack to escape!"). When one team is completely defeated, or when the Judge is ready to rule in one side's favor, the round is over. Winning teams keep their used Warriors as victory cards. The game ends when everyone has had a chance to be the Judge once or twice (depending on the number of players), and the teams with the most victory cards is the winner.
164086.name: Super Story War

164087.description:
“PALEON”, a board game with PvP tactics made in Japan, has already sold more than 340,000 sets.

In this game, you are a paleontologist who can pass through time by the time machine. You visit different eras in the Prehistory and collect the various cards of primitive life forms. When you come back to the present time, you submit these rare card you collected to “the Paleontological Society”. The player who submit the RAREST card at one meeting wins and be promoted to one higher rank as a paleontologist. When you are promoted 4 times at meetings from the lowest rank ‘a student’, you become ‘a professor’ in the end and wins the game.
164087.name: PALEON

164088.description:
From GMT Games product page:

Regular 22 x 34 inch game map, but mounted - same quality as Washington's War, Here I Stand, Sword of Rome, Wilderness War, and Paths of Glory reprints.
boardgameaccessory: Mr. Madison's War: The Incredible War of 1812
164088.name: Mr. Madison's War: The Incredible War of 1812 – Mounted Mapboard

164089.description:
Faction/Type: Mechana Construct
Cost: 3 Rune
Value: 3 Honor
Effect: Once per turn, when you play a Mechana Construct (including this one), add a card to the center row
164089.name: Ascension: Temporal Excavator Promo Card

164090.description:
Cost: 5 Rune
Value: 3 Honor
Effect: Defeat a random monster in the void without paying its cost and put it on the bottom of the center deck
164090.name: Ascension: Eternal Tormentor Promo Card

164091.description:
Reis de Portugal is a card game about Portuguese kings and queens. Each game is played over three rounds. In each round, one dynasty plays as the trump. Trump cards can win against other dynasty cards, but they give zero victory points. At the end of each round, players get points by gathering cards from different dynasties. Dynasties award different amounts of points depending on the round being played.

There are also some special cards that give extra points or even others that allow different effects during play.

Each card has a Bonus that can be triggered by the player initiating the trick, adding more strategy and density to the game.
164091.name: Reis de Portugal

164092.name: Hvem er den bedste billist?
164092.description:
An entertaining and learning game for everyone who wants to pass the driving exams, but also for the expierenced drivers!

The purpose of the game is to gain knowledge of the trafic in a hunoristic way - or maybe refresh the knowledge you already have (or used to have!).

The game board have two areas, the outter and the inner:
At first you use the outter board, in a classic Monopoly style, to gain six (6) trafic signs in various categories. Your opponents may try to irritate you so you fail.

If you get the six signs you can then, as you pass START turn into the inner board (called The City), where your driving skills will be testet, as different obsticles tries to keep you away from your aim.

First player who manage to get to Finish first is the winner and can proudly say that they are the best driver!

164093.name: Duet (2013)
videogamehonor: 2014 AGD Awards Excellence In Audio Winner
2014 AGD Awards Excellence In Design Winner
2014 AGD Awards Game of the Year Nominee
164093.description:
Duet is a hypnotic action arcade game with a mesmerizingly beautiful soundtrack by Melbourne composer and Gotye multi-instrumentalist Tim Shiel.

-Over 50 challenging stages across 9 chapters full of elegant obstacles and features to keep you on the edge of your seat.

-An outstanding soundtrack by Tim Shiel, his debut to the video game world.

-Simple two touch control – left or right thumb to spin.
Entrancing visuals fit the mood and audio of the game perfectly.

-Unlock an endless Survival mode for high score delight.

-Strange and wonderful narrative that will keep you guessing.

-Every mistake leaves a mark; you will paint the walls with your failures.

from publisher/developer site: http://www.kumobius.com/blog/

164094.name: Bíborhold (Season 2, Issue 1 - Jan 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Mitológiai ABC - A medúza, a banshee
164094.description:
Table of Contents:

Gólem (fantasynovella) 2
Ravenloft világa 5
AD&D (Kalandok és Sárkányok) rovat 6
A sötét tündék l0
A küldetés (fantasy novella) 12
A bölcs tanácsai 15
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles szerepjáték 16
Galéria (könyvismertetők) 18
Rejtvény 20
Humor 21
Ajándék (fantasynovella) 22
Mitológiai ABC 24
Túlélék Földje - Setét Patkány naplója 26
Lovagrendek 28
Számítógépes rovat 30
Angus Dewer 32

164095.description:
A set of 14 cards designed for the digital port of Boss Monster, and offered as a physical bonus. Comprised of:

Epic Hero - The Princess
Boss - Greg
Boss - Explodo
Boss - Chase

and two apiece of:

Spell - Fireball
Trap Room - Demon Circle
Trap Room - The Clock Tower
Monster Room - Hydra's Mire
Monster Room - Spellslime Incubator

Some of these cards require the use of dice or tokens as they are designed to take advantage of the virtual nature of digital Boss Monster.
164095.name: Boss Monster: Paper & Pixels

164096.name: Find the Bug!
164096.description:
The power of games to teach abstract concepts is more and more acknowledged. Find the Bug! offers an introduction to IT testing through a fast and simple board game.

The application is simulated by a game board divided into a number of components. Each component has a unique number of bugs with a unique level of severity. The test leads take turn to analyse the application (to learn where bugs are likely to find) and to place testers in the application (to find those bugs). Each bug scores a value according to its severity level.

Once a set of components is perceived to be bug free, a test lead may let a tester cover the entire set and thus increase the probability of finding bugs in the next round. However, if the test lead is wrong, the tester's effort is lost so don't be too fast!

The winner is the one who finds most bugs.

Find the Bug! is mainly designed for IT professionals who want to learn testing in a fun way. However, ordinary gamers may also enjoy this deductive challenge where you must use your limited resources efficiently and monitor the other player's actions carefully to Find the Bug!

Game mechanisms include:

1. Changing and hidden game board: The number, value and location of the bugs is different in each game and they are hidden to the players.
2. Player balance: The players have the same amount of testers and are always equally strong.
3. Predictable odds: To find a bug requires luck but the more pre-analysis a player does, the better are the odds for finding them.
4. Open end: The potentially high end game score makes every game open until the very end.
5. Educational: The game teaches IT testing in a game context

164097.name: Brain Slugs from Planet X (Aether)
164097.description:
From publisher blurb:

They Came from the Stars to send you to the Grave!

After a mysterious crash, two teachers return to school and they're just not quite...right. You and your friends start to put together some clues about them and the janitor and your missing friend, and the dead girl in the work shop. Yup...the clues are becoming less subtle all the time...

At the crux of all of this is a group of three body-snatching brain slugs that just want to get home, but they understand that they can't have any witnesses, even if that means killing every single kid in the High School. The Player Characters are all high school kids, and the adventure includes several templates to use, hitting all the tropes to let you adapt this to any time period, from the 1930's clear up through the modern age!

This adventure is at home in the 60's, 70's, and 80's, and it revolves around the kids being the problem-solvers, staring at the center of their very own B-movie. It also utilizes the High School map put together by the always-awesome Fabled Environments, and while this adventure does not require it, it was built specifically to use their map!

164098.name: Brain Slugs from Planet X (Savage Worlds)
164098.description:
From publisher blurb:
